page.title: 13Wildlife in the area i
page.content: In the park there are{Fallow deeer, {Roe deer}and occasionally{Muntjac. Fallow deer are black and white and they sometimes have spots. Roe deer are a foxy red. The fallow deer is the biggest. Roe deer eat leaves and bram _bles and Fallow eat grass and farmers crops.{Mr. Brown}is in quite a lot of risk from poachers.{Five deer are {taken every week by poachers.}Deer are generally{nocturnal}animals. Mr. Brown does the bulk of the culling. Culling is when the weak, old and unhealthy are slaughtered. People are invited to shoot the old deer to mount their heads on the walls of their houses. Deer keeping is a hard job and, as the poached deer carcasses are worth Â£60 he has to keep a good lookout for poachers. Continued on page {14
